Dialogues: Orbitals can have positive and negative phases.
Here, the positive phase is pink, and the negative phase is blue.
Let’s look at a slice of a different orbital.
The graph you see is the real part of the wave function, Ψ, of the orbital. Ψ has no physical meaning.
Where the wave function is positive, it creates a pink, positive phase, and vice versa.
But what about when it is zero?
Find out in the next module.
